summary: An email chain forwarded to the FBI and US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the USA v. Maxwell case. The chain contains a tip from Mike Jones suggesting that Johan Eliasch, a Swedish businessman living in the UK, may have ties to the case and recommending a search of his aircraft logs.

persons.name: Mike Jones
persons.context: Individual who emails the US Attorney's Office with information suggesting Johan Eliasch may have ties to the USA v. Maxwell case and recommends searching his aircraft logs.

persons.name: Johan Eliasch
persons.context: Swedish businessman living in the UK who is suggested by Mike Jones to have possible ties to the underlying acts in the USA v. Maxwell case. He owns three aircraft.

persons.name: Paul Byrne
persons.context: FBI agent copied on the forwarded email chain regarding the tip about Johan Eliasch.

connections.description: Mike Jones states he has been 'doing a lot of work with regards to Johan Eliasch over the previous 2-3 years' and is providing a tip about him to prosecutors.
Mike Jones suggests Johan Eliasch 'may also have some ties to the underlying acts' in the USA v. Maxwell case, implying a potential connection to Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Tip forwarded to FBI and SDNY
events.description: An email tip from Mike Jones regarding Johan Eliasch is forwarded within the US Attorney's Office and to FBI agent Paul Byrne in the context of the USA v. Maxwell investigation.

events.title: Initial tip email sent
events.description: Mike Jones sends an initial email to a US Attorney introducing himself and suggesting Johan Eliasch may have ties to the USA v. Maxwell case.

keyFacts: A tipster named Mike Jones suggests Swedish businessman Johan Eliasch may have ties to the underlying acts in the USA v. Maxwell case.
Jones recommends searching the logs of Eliasch's three aircraft, noting one recently changed its tail number to an Aruba registration.
The tip was forwarded to FBI agent Paul Byrne and the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on July 13, 2020.
Johan Eliasch is identified as a non-US citizen, Swedish, living in the UK.
The correspondence shows the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell was receiving external tips regarding potential associates and their travel records.
